stance_1: I feel meat fills my family up faster
stance_2: I prepare meat for my family most nights
justification: The interviewee explicitly states that the main reason they prepare meat most nights is because it fills the family up faster.

stance_1: I have meat-free nights to save money
justification: The interviewee explicitly states that they started having meat-free nights because meat is expensive.

stance_1: I have meat-free nights to save money
stance_2: I prepare meat for my family most nights
justification: Having meat-free nights to save money reduces the frequency of preparing meat for the family, indicating a partial conflict.

stance_1: I prepare meat for my family most nights
stance_2: I think we are meant to eat meat
justification: The belief that 'we are meant to eat meat' provides an implicit motivational support for preparing meat most nights, though this connection is not directly stated.
